plot: Bart wins the annual "last day of school" race - with a little help from Nelson - and Homer attempts to bring back 4th of July fireworks, which have been canceled due to low budget cuts.

Bart is plagued with guilt when he wins the annual "last day of school" race around Springfield Elementary, with an assist from Nelson, who beats up frontrunner Milhouse. Meanwhile, Homer tries to bring back the annual 4th of July fireworks display after it's canceled for budget reasons.—Jiilo_Kim

Bart is racked with guilt after he left Milhouse to get beaten up by Nelson Muntz so that he could beat him in the round the school race and is afterwards reviled as a coward. However when Homer decides to put on a Fourth of July firework display with dangerous home-made rockets which threaten to shoot into the crowd of on-lookers Bart manages not only to save the situation but assuage his guilt by making it look as if Milhouse was the hero.—don @ minifie-1
